column4: What does it mean when your .bashrc file has a word and ()?  How are you to execute that function?
But how do I use it?
it's a function named "extract".  I don't understand your question.
pastebin what you are talking about
your bashrc is likely not sourced when you ssh
what do you mean not sourced?
how do I ensure that that funciton is always available for all methods and users?
put it in a file that gets sourced system-wide.  What do you mean by "all methods"?
as in, having that function available if I'm SSHing, or using GUI or PHP's method to execute system functions, etc.
put it in /etc/profile or similar.  No idea what php does
it's not evil.  But people often try to brute force the root account...
so ask the person that told you that...?  Anyway, there's no root account by default in ubuntu and it isn't necessary either
what I mean to say is the root account is locked by default
